thread.title: Gold Near 5-Year Low After China Unveils Gold Reserve Holdings
thread.title_full: Gold Near 5-Year Low After China Unveils Gold Reserve Holdings - Bloomberg Business

author: Eddie Van Der Walt
title: Gold Near 5-Year Low After China Unveils Gold Reserve Holdings
text:
Gold traded near a five-year low after China released data on its gold reserve holdings for the first time since 2009.
Bullion futures for August delivery slipped 0.1 percent to $1,142.60 as of 11:40 a.m. on the Comex in New York. Prices have fallen for seven days, the longest streak of losses since November 2014.
China said it raised reserves of the metal by 57 percent since 2009, the last time it updated the figures. The country now owns about 1,658 metric tons, the People’s Bank of China said in a statement.
“Prices completely shrugged this off. There was no market reaction at all,” Carsten Fritsch, an analyst at Commerzbank AG, said by phone from Frankfurt. “Since it was accumulated over a long period of time, the tonnage per annum was not really massive.”
China is now the fifth-biggest holder by country, moving up one place above Russia, according to the London-based World Gold Council.
